title: Exabeam Advanced Analytics
descriptionMarkdown: The [Exabeam Advanced Analytics](https://www.exabeam.com/ueba/advanced-analytics-and-mitre-detect-and-stop-threats/) data connector provides the capability to ingest Exabeam Advanced Analytics events into Microsoft Sentinel. Refer to [Exabeam Advanced Analytics documentation](https://docs.exabeam.com/) for more information.
additionalRequirementBanner: These queries are dependent on a parser based on a Kusto Function deployed as part of the solution.

sampleQueries.query:
ExabeamEvent
 | summarize count() by SrcIpAddr
 | top 10 by count_

dataTypes.name: Syslog (Exabeam)
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
ExabeamEvent
            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

value:
ExabeamEvent
            | summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
            | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(30d)

instructionSteps.description: >**NOTE:** This data connector depends on a parser based on a Kusto Function to work as expected which is deployed as part of the solution. To view the function code in Log Analytics, open Log Analytics/Microsoft Sentinel Logs blade, click Functions and search for the alias Exabeam Advanced Analytics and load the function code or click [here](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/master/Solutions/Exabeam%20Advanced%20Analytics/Parsers/ExabeamEvent.txt), on the second line of the query, enter the hostname(s) of your Exabeam Advanced Analytics device(s) and any other unique identifiers for the logstream. The function usually takes 10-15 minutes to activate after solution installation/update.
>**NOTE:** This data connector has been developed using Exabeam Advanced Analytics i54 (Syslog)

instructionSteps.title: 1. Install and onboard the agent for Linux or Windows
instructionSteps.description:
Install the agent on the server where the Exabeam Advanced Analytic logs are generated or forwarded.

> Logs from Exabeam Advanced Analytic deployed on Linux or Windows servers are collected by **Linux** or **Windows** agents.

parameters.title: Choose where to install the Linux agent:

instructionSteps.title: Install agent on Azure Linux Virtual Machine
instructionSteps.description: Select the machine to install the agent on and then click **Connect**.

instructionSteps.title: Install agent on a non-Azure Linux Machine
instructionSteps.description: Download the agent on the relevant machine and follow the instructions.

parameters.title: Choose where to install the Windows agent:

instructionSteps.title: Install agent on Azure Windows Virtual Machine
instructionSteps.description: Select the machine to install the agent on and then click **Connect**.

instructionSteps.title: Install agent on a non-Azure Windows Machine
instructionSteps.description: Download the agent on the relevant machine and follow the instructions.
